snippet: A large genetic study has identified common glitches involved in schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, autism, major depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
abstract: Study published online in journal Lancet identifies several common genetic glitches that can nudge brain along path to schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, autism, major depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder; authors of study say it is largest genetic study yet of psychiatric disorders, and involved examination of genetic data of more than 60,000 people worldwide.
lead_paragraph: A large genetic study has identified common glitches involved in schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, autism, major depression and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

headline.seo: Study Finds Genetic Risk Factors Shared by 5 Psychiatric Disorders
headline.main: 5 Disorders Share Genetic Risk Factors, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: 5 Disorders Share Genetic Risk Factors, Study Finds
